title: Work done by gas using a graph

content.question: An ideal gas is taken from initial state i at pressure P0 and volume V0 to final state f at pressure 2P0 and volume 2V0. The figures below represent four possible processes by which the gas can be taken from state i to state f. For which process is the work done by the gas greatest?

choices.label: Option A has a straight line with an arrowhead that points from point i to point f.
Option B has a line that is concave down with an arrowhead that points from point i to f.

Option C has a straight vertical line with an arrowhead that points from point i to the point V sub zero, 2 P sub zero. From this point there is a straight horizontal line with an arrowhead that points to the right to point f.

Option D has a straight horizontal line with an arrowhead that points from point i to the point 2 V sub zero, P sub zero. From this point there is a straight vertical line with an arrowhead that points up to point f.

content.answer: Option C has a straight vertical line with an arrowhead that points from point i to the point V sub zero, 2 P sub zero. From this point there is a straight horizontal line with an arrowhead that points to the right to point f.
